meanings.definition: To move or draw towards the midline of the body
meanings.sent1: She tried to adduct her arms to her sides during the exercise.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist instructed the patient to adduct his leg towards the center of his body.
meanings.sent3: In the dance class, they jokingly pretended to adduct their legs like robots.
meanings.sent4: The magnet seemed to adduct the metal filings towards its center, as if by magic.
meanings.sent5: The gravitational pull of the planet seemed to adduct the spaceship towards its core.

meanings.definition: A muscle that draws a body part towards the midline of the body
meanings.sent1: The adduct in his shoulder allowed him to bring his arm closer to his body.
meanings.sent2: During the anatomy class, they discussed the function of the adduct in the leg.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was having an incredibly strong adduct in his arms.
meanings.sent4: The adduct in the robot's arm worked efficiently, pulling the arm towards the body.
meanings.sent5: The adduct in the bird's wing helped it to fold its wing neatly against its body.
